page.title: 01Kirtlington
page.content: These pages were compiled by the children of Kirtlington School, helped by the ladies of Kirtlington W.I.. Mentioned in the original Domesday Book, Kirtlington is situated about twelve miles north of Oxford. It is surrounded on one side by Kirtlington Park and the landscape on the other side slopes down towards the Oxford Canal. The road through Kirtlington crosses Akeman Street at the northern end and leads on to the U.S.A.F. Base at Upper Heyford. The population of Kirtlington has grown to approximately 960 in recent years with housing development discreetly contained "inside" the village. There is one church in Kirtlington, it is Church of England. There are 9 ponds and lakes in the area. Next to Kytes Pond there is a Village Hall.
